Class DoorManager

java.lang.Object
DoorManager
public class DoorManager extends Object

The DoorManager class is responsible for controlling the opening and closing of the elevator doors. It acts as an abstraction layer for door operations, ensuring that commands are sent persistently until the desired door state is confirmed.

This manager relies on an instance of ElevatorAPI to interact with the underlying elevator hardware's door mechanisms and sensors. It includes retry logic to enhance robustness, continuously sending commands and checking door status until the operation (open or close) is successfully completed.

  • Constructor Details

    • DoorManager

      public DoorManager(ElevatorAPI elevator)
      Constructs a new DoorManager instance, associating it with a specific ElevatorAPI instance. This linkage allows the `DoorManager` to send commands and receive feedback directly from the elevator's hardware interface.
      Parameters:
      elevator - The ElevatorAPI instance that this DoorManager will use to control and monitor the elevator doors. This parameter must not be null.

  • Method Details

    • openIfClosed

      public void openIfClosed() throws Exception
      Attempts to open the elevator door if it is currently closed. This method first checks if the door is already open; if so, it does nothing. If the door is closed, it enters a loop, repeatedly sending the "open door" command and pausing briefly (200 milliseconds) until the elevator's sensor confirms that the door is fully open. This retry mechanism ensures the command's execution even if the initial attempt doesn't register immediately.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the communication with the ElevatorAPI while attempting to open the door or check its status. This could be due to underlying Modbus communication issues or hardware failures.

    • closeIfOpen

      public void closeIfOpen() throws Exception
      Attempts to close the elevator door if it is currently open. This method first checks if the door is already closed; if so, it does nothing. If the door is open, it enters a loop, repeatedly sending the "close door" command and pausing briefly (200 milliseconds) until the elevator's sensor confirms that the door is fully closed. Similar to `openIfClosed()`, this retry logic ensures the door operation is completed reliably.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the communication with the ElevatorAPI while attempting to close the door or check its status. This could indicate underlying Modbus communication issues or hardware failures.
